title: Financials Up on Value Bets — Financials Roundup
text:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions rose as traders continued to buy into sectors whose performance has lagged "momentum" stocks during the 10-year bull market.

Credit Suisse Group shares fell after the Swiss bank launched an investigation into its surveillance of a departing top executive, Iqbal Khan, who is joining crosstown rival UBS Group, after the executive filed a report with Zurich police.

Citadel Limited Partnership sold $500 million in investment-grade bonds earlier this month to fund a dividend to owners including founder Kenneth Griffin, an unusual move for most hedge funds but the second time in three years Citadel has done so.

Major stock-market indexes remained poised at psychologically significant milestones first tested at the start of 2018, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average near the 27,000 level and the broad Standard & Poor's 500 stalled around 3,000.
